content: mini skein sampler by crystal bergstrom sonnetofthemoon blogspot com the mini skein sampler scarf is my new favorite way to show off the beauty of hand dyed yarn and to use all of the precious mini skeins i ve been collecting hoarding it s a diagonal garter stitch scarf with eyelet transitions between colors slipped stitches are used along the sides to give it a smooth finished look this scarf is easy enough for beginning knitters and fun for all simple by design this pattern is all about showing off the yarn what you will need  yarn mini skeins totaling 100g/440 yds small ish scarf to 200g/880 yds longer or wider scarf of fingering weight yarn sometimes called sock yarn  needles size 3 3 25mm or needle size that gives you a fabric you like  gauge approximately 26 sts/4 inches gauge is not particularly important for this scarf the most important thing is to knit up a fabric you like if your gauge is a little different than the pattern your scarf will be a little skinnier or wider…but it s a scarf it will be lovely in any size size  100g/440 yds of fingering weight yarn 6 5 x50 before blocking 6 x60 after blocking  if you would like to knit a wider or skinnier scarf adjust gauge or increase/reduce the number of stitches you cast on making sure to cast on an odd number of stitches for a longer scarf just add more minis  if you are adapting the size or gauge keep in mind that this scarf will become longer and skinnier after blocking/wearing © crystal bergstrom sonnet of the moon abbreviations co cast on long tail cast on recommended rs right side when you are knitting a rs row the cast on tail will be on the right ws wrong side when you are knitting a ws row the cast on tail will be on the left st/sts stitch/stitches k knit stitch k2tog knit slip_stitch k to last 3 stitches k2tog k 65 sts  repeat row 1 and 2 until you are almost out of yarn or reach the desired width of your stripe always end your yarn after knitting a right side row row
